Title: VyStar Veterans Memorial Arena
Description: The VyStar Veterans Memorial Arena is a multi-purpose indoor arena located in Jacksonville, Florida, United States. Since its opening in 2003, the venue has hosted several UFC events, including UFC 249 in 2020, which marked the return of live sports during the COVID-19 pandemic. The arena has a seating capacity of approximately 15,000 for UFC events and has become a popular destination for mixed martial arts fans.

Title: Wachovia Center
Description: The Wachovia Center, located in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, has served as a prominent venue for UFC events. It has hosted several notable UFC fights, including UFC 101: Declaration, UFC 133: Evans vs. Ortiz, and UFC 133: Penn vs. Fitch. With a seating capacity of over 19,500, the Wachovia Center continues to attract fans from around the world for thrilling UFC matchups.

Title: Wells Fargo Center
Description: The Wells Fargo Center, located in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, is a prominent venue for UFC events. Title: Wembley Arena
Description: Wembley Arena, located in London, England, has hosted several notable UFC events. In 2002, UFC 38 took place at the venue, featuring a welterweight championship bout between Matt Hughes and Carlos Newton. Additionally, UFC 85 in 2008 showcased a middleweight clash between Nate Marquardt and Thales Leites. With a seating capacity of 12,500, Wembley Arena continues to be a popular choice for UFC events in the United Kingdom.

Title: Yokohama Arena
Description: The Yokohama Arena is a multi-purpose indoor arena located in Yokohama, Japan. It has hosted several UFC events, including UFC 23 in 1999, UFC 25 in 2000, and UFC Fight Night: Barnett vs. Nelson in 2015. The arena has a seating capacity of approximately 17,000 and is known for its state-of-the-art facilities and excellent acoustics.

Title: Yoyogi National Gymnasium
Description: Yoyogi National Gymnasium, located in Tokyo, Japan, has hosted several UFC events. Notable events include UFC 23 in 1999, UFC 25 in 2000, and UFC 29 in 2000. The venue, with a seating capacity of 13,291, has provided a platform for numerous thrilling fights and has become a popular destination for UFC fans in Japan.

Title: Yubileyny Sports Palace
Description: The Yubileyny Sports Palace is a multi-purpose indoor arena located in St. Petersburg, Russia. It has hosted several UFC events, including UFC Fight Night: Volkov vs. Struve in 2017 and UFC Fight Night: Overeem vs. Oleinik in 2019.
